links.title: Market Wrap March 1, 2018
links.description: Thursday marked the third distribution day in a row for the Nasdaq and the S&P 500. The market uptrend is now under pressure, which means investors must be more cautious. The market was negative and sold off in February with sharp action. I would rather have seen a more controlled descent.

messages.body: $TSLA you bulls are a resilient bunch!  I cashed in some shorts today in hopes you guys still have another round in you. Cmon you can do it!
$TSLA Good luck to Jaguar selling their new electric car. Regarding TSLA, this is irrelevant. Both will take market share from ICEs.
$TSLA lets give a 12y/o with ADHD and many comic books 30B in cash and see what companies he can come up with.
$TSLA i-pace!? you have to be the same spec.  same super charger network etc. + half the price to be able to compete.
$TSLA did CNBC cover the new Jag?of course not. It‚Äôs only about Tesla.
$TSLA The i-pace " will charge from 0 - 80 percent in 85 minutes on public 50kW DC chargers". 85 minutes? Get a Tesla and use Superchargers.

messages.body:
$TSLA People told Elon landing a reusable rocket can't be done. He did it. Now he aims for a 100% automated factory. 
https://www.forbes.com/sites/jonmarkman/2018/02/28/tesla-revolution-is-the-factory-not-the-car/#1ff7a93c7547

links.title: Tesla Revolution Is The Factory, Not The Car
links.description: Critics say the Tesla Model 3 looks like a budget Mazda. That is fair. But they are missing the point. The project represents a revolution. Recently Electrek, a popular green energy publisher, reported that suppliers have begun ramping up deliveries to the factory where the Model 3 is produced.
